Package it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Logic.States.Implementations

Class MainLoop

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Logic.States.GameState
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Logic.States.SynchronousGameState
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Logic.States.Implementations.MainLoop
public class MainLoop extends SynchronousGameState
The MainLoop class represents the main game loop state in a synchronous game. This class extends SynchronousGameState and handles the main logic for the game during its active state.

  • Field Summary

  • Method Details

    • playCard

      public void playCard(Player player, int cardIndex, int coordinateIndex, boolean faceUp) throws NotYourTurnException, InvalidActionForPlayerStateException, InvalidGameInputException
      Attempts to play a card. The default implementation throws an exception as this action is not allowed in the current state. Subclasses can override this method to define the behavior for playing a card in the specific state.
      Overrides:
      playCard in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is placing the card.
      cardIndex - The index of the card in the player's hand.
      coordinateIndex - The index of the available coordinate in the cardMap where the card will be placed.
      faceUp - True if the card should be placed face up, false if face down.
      Throws:
      NotYourTurnException - Thrown if the player attempts to place a card out of turn.
      InvalidActionForPlayerStateException - Thrown if the player attempts an invalid action in their current state.
      InvalidGameInputException

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(Player player, CardPoolTypes cardPoolType, int index) throws NotYourTurnException, InvalidActionForPlayerStateException
      Attempts to draw a card. The default implementation throws an exception as this action is not allowed in the current state. Subclasses can override this method to define the behavior for drawing a card in the specific state.
      Overrides:
      drawCard in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is drawing the card.
      cardPoolType - The type of card pool from which the card will be drawn.
      index - The index of the card in the card pool.
      Throws:
      NotYourTurnException - Thrown if the player attempts to draw a card out of turn.
      InvalidActionForPlayerStateException - Thrown if the player attempts an invalid action in their current state.

    • shouldRemovePlayerOnDisconnect

      public boolean shouldRemovePlayerOnDisconnect()
      Determines if the player should be removed from the game upon disconnection. The default implementation returns true, Subclasses can override this method if they want to implement resilience to disconnections.
      Overrides:
      shouldRemovePlayerOnDisconnect in class GameState
      Returns:
      True if the player should be removed on disconnection, false otherwise.

    • userDisconnectionProcedure

      public void userDisconnectionProcedure(Player player)
      Handles user disconnection.
      If the user that disconnected was the current player then it makes the next player the current to avoid getting stuck on a disconnected player.
      Overrides:
      userDisconnectionProcedure in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The user who disconnected.

    • userReconnectionProcedure

      public void userReconnectionProcedure(Player player)
      Handles the reconnection procedure for a player in the game's Main Loop state. Restores the player's previous state and updates card drawability for the reconnected player.
      Overrides:
      userReconnectionProcedure in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is reconnecting to the game.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(Player player)
      Removes a player from the game and updates the current player index accordingly.
      If the removed player is the current player, it finds the next player to take the turn.
      Overrides:
      removePlayer in class SynchronousGameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player to remove.

    • determinePlayerState

      public PlayerStates determinePlayerState(Player player)
      Determines the state of the player based on the current game phase and connection status.
      Specified by:
      determinePlayerState in class SynchronousGameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the state is to be determined.
      Returns:
      The state of the player.

    • nextState

      protected void nextState()
      Switches the game state to the next state.
      Check for the boolean LastRoundFlag. If true then the next state will be the FinalRound, otherwise the next state will be another MainLoop.
      Specified by:
      nextState in class GameState

      public GameRecord toRecord()
      Description copied from class: GameState

      Overrides:

      Returns:
